newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Grolsch to brew beer on Aruba island -ANP.
newsitem.headline: Grolsch to brew beer on Aruba island -ANP.

text.p: Dutch brewer Koninklijke Grolsch Brouwerij will participate in the first brewery on the Caribbean island of Aruba, Dutch news agency ANP said on Saturday.

The Aruba Brouwerij is being set up on the island in conjuction with local businesses and a German investor group. A sum of 20 million guilders, mainly financed through a consortium of local banks, will be needed to set up the business, ANP said, but did not detail Grolsch's financial commitment.
The new venture will brew Grolsch beer under licence as well as its own local product for sale throughout the Dutch Antilles.
Around 40 people will be employed at the new brewery, due to be operational in a year's time, ANP added. No production figures were given.
The other Dutch brewery in the area is the Amstel brewery on the island of Curacao. Controlled by brewing giant Heineken, it also exports to the other islands of the Antilles.
